result.execSummary:
The defendant Devonte Parks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence. Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Continue in school and obtain High School Diploma.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Do not drive unless properly licensed and obtain a valid drivers license. Follow the rules at the foster home. Continue in programming at Harvest Consulting Write an apology letter and turn it into the agent. No contact with the victim L.A.F. & W.B.Y. (person, property, residence or family) or the co defendants C.B. or H.K. Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.

AMENDED 03-22-2017: STAYED TIME IS LIFTED. Defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion and after serving at least 45 days, the balance of jail time is STAYED and defendant must complete all recommended continuing care under the supervision of the Department of Corrections.

***TO BE CO-SIGNED BY: LASHONDA LANG, D.O.B. 3-27-1974***
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). DBY & LAF   No contact with the co-defendant. CB & KH   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 11-23-2015:  Defendant must live at 1820 Geneva Street and follow all house rules.  Defendant may only leave home to attend school upon confirmation of good standing, attend church with Ms. Lang, meet with attorney and attend court hearings.  No social media that would allow defendant to communicate with victims or co-actors.  No communication devices such as phones or internet except for attending school on line.  No alcohol or controlled substances.**
